description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows Telephony Server remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-43518):

1. Identify your Windows version and corresponding build number from the list below.

- **Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems**: 10.0.26100.2033, KB5044284  
- **Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems**: 10.0.22631.4317, KB5044285  
- **Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems**: 10.0.22621.4317, KB5044285  
- **Windows 11 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems**: 10.0.22000.3260, KB5044280  
- **Windows 10 for x64-based Systems**: 10.0.10240.20796, KB5044286  

2. Download and install the relevant updates through the Windows Update catalog.
3. Restart your system to apply the changes effectively.

**Details**:
- This fix addresses a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability, which can lead to remote code execution.
- Ensure your system is compliant with the above Windows build specifications before proceeding to installation.

Update packages can be found at the following links:  
- [KB5044284](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044284)  
- [KB5044285](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044285)  
- [KB5044286](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044286)  
- [KB5044273](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044273)  
- [KB5044280](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5044280).
